page.title: 01Elford - Introduction
page.content: Elford is a village of about 550 inhabitants lying in the valley of the Tame, 4 miles north of Tamworth and 10 miles south of Burton-upon-Trent. The A -class road between these towns skirts the village of Elford to the east and, as the nearest river crossing is Elford Bridge, half a mile to the south, the village itself provides no thorough fare for traffic. In this probably lies an important reason for its attractiveness. There are four areas of woodland, the remainder of the block is mainly arable and dairy farming, with transport and gravel industries.
